learning_outcomes: Can understand and use familiar everyday expressions and very basic phrases aimed at the satisfaction of needs of a concrete type.
Can introduce him/herself and others and can ask and answer questions about personal details such as where he/she lives, people he/she knows and things he/she has.
Can interact in a simple way provided the other person talks slowly and clearly and is prepared to help.
language_focus_topics: Review A0: Alphabet, basic pronunciation, bezañ/endevout (present), articles, basic mutations.
Nouns: Plural formation (common suffixes: -où, -ed, -ien; internal vowel changes - basic). Gender agreement with articles.
Adjectives: Basic agreement (often invariable or simple feminine forms). Position (usually after the noun).
Verbs: Present tense of common regular verbs (e.g., kanañ - to sing, lenn - to read, skrivañ - to write). Verbal noun as infinitive.
Verbs: Past tense (Amzer dremenet strizh - e.g., -as, -is endings or with 'ober' + verbal noun). Future tense (Amzer da zont - e.g., -o, -i endings or with 'mont da' + verbal noun).
Consonant Mutations: More practice with soft mutation (after 'da', 'e', common prepositions). Introduction to spirant mutation (kemmadur c'hwezh) after 'va', 'he', 'o'.
Pronouns: Possessive determiners (ma, da, e, he, hon, ho, o + mutations).

Prepositions: Common simple prepositions (e.g., e, e-barzh - in; war - on; da - to; gant - with; eus - from; dre - through). Inflected prepositions (1st/2nd person singular of common ones like 'din' - to me, 'ganin' - with me).
Sentence Structure: Simple VSO and SVO patterns. Using particles like 'a', 'e', 'o' with verbs.
vocabulary_topics: Personal information: Family members (extended), age, professions.
Daily routine: Describing typical daily activities with times.
Food & Drink: Common food items, drinks, meals (merenn, koan), ordering in a restaurant.
Shopping: Types of shops (stal), common items, prices, quantities.
Places in town: straed, plasenn, liorzh, sinema, mirdi, iliz, ti-kêr, post, bank.
Transport: karr-boutin/bus, tren, metro, taxi, karr-nij, marc'h-houarn. Buying tickets.
Time: Telling the time, days of the week, months, seasons, dates.
Weather: Describing weather conditions (tomm eo, yen eo, glav a ra, erc'h a ra).
Hobbies & interests (lenn, sellet ouzh ar skinwel, selaou sonerezh).
pronunciation_focus_topics: Review A0 sounds, nasal vowels, stress.
Pronunciation of mutated consonants (soft and spirant).
Distinction between voiced/unvoiced consonants in different positions.
Vowel length (short vs. long vowels - basic awareness).
Intonation of questions with interrogative words.
listening_comprehension_skills: Understand frequently used words and phrases related to personal details, family, shopping, local area, when spoken slowly and clearly.
Grasp the main point in short, clear, simple messages and announcements.
Understand simple questions and instructions related to everyday situations.
reading_comprehension_skills: Understand short, simple texts on familiar matters (e.g., simple menus, public signs, short personal messages).
Find specific, predictable information in everyday material.
Understand short, simple personal notes or postcards.
spoken_interaction_skills: Ask and answer questions about familiar topics.
Make and respond to simple suggestions or invitations.
Ask for and give basic information about time, quantity, and price.
spoken_production_skills: Describe his/her family, living conditions, and daily routine in simple terms.
Describe simple past events using basic past tense forms.
written_interaction_skills: Write a simple reply to a personal message or invitation.
written_production_skills: Write short, simple notes, messages, or postcards.
Describe a familiar place or person in a few simple, connected sentences.
Fill in simple forms with personal details.
cultural_competence_topics: Basic Breton customs related to local festivals (festoù-noz - basic idea).
Awareness of traditional Breton music and dance.
learning_strategies_suggestions: Practice identifying and applying basic consonant mutations.
Use language learning apps or websites specifically for Breton, if available.
Listen to Breton folk music or simple stories.
Try to form simple sentences incorporating prepositions and possessives.
